main event: A cigar or tube-shaped object, approximately 22 feet long and gold in color, was sighted orbiting over a town near Cold Spring, New York on December 13, 1958.
interesting points: The object had two fins on the side and emitted a high-pitched sound.
The object was observed making a 360-degree turn and disappearing without leaving any trails.
The sighting was reported by multiple witnesses, including personnel from a nearby air force base.
Radar tracking data was collected on the object, which showed it flying at various altitudes and speeds.
The sighting occurred during dusk, with the object being observed for around 30 minutes.
sighted object: cigar or tube-shaped object, approximately 22 feet long and gold in color
location: Cold Spring, New York, 3 miles northeast of West Point
witnesses: multiple, including personnel from a nearby air force base
